entities.name: draco
entities.description: Draco is mentioned as someone who needs to move the unconscious men outside, indicating he has some level of authority or responsibility in the situation. ("Draco, move this scum outside")

entities.name: bellatrix
entities.description: Bellatrix is mentioned as someone who gives orders and seems to be in charge of the situation. She is also described as screaming and shrieking, indicating her level of emotion and urgency. ("Draco, move this scum outside", "Do it! You have no idea of the danger we're in!")

entities.name: narcissa
entities.description: Narcissa is mentioned as someone who furiously speaks up against Bellatrix's behavior, indicating she may be opposed to Bellatrix's actions or decisions. ("Don't you dare speak to Draco like --")

entities.name: potter
entities.description: Potter is mentioned as someone who must not be harmed, indicating he may be a person of importance or significance in the situation. ("If it is indeed Potter, he must not be harmed")

entities.name: the dark lord
entities.description: The Dark Lord is mentioned as someone who wishes to dispose of Potter himself, indicating a level of control or authority over the situation. ("The Dark Lord wishes to dispose of Potter himself")

entities.name: the sword
entities.description: The sword is mentioned as something that Bellatrix examines, indicating its importance or significance in the situation. ("She stood, panting slightly, looking down at the sword, examining its hilt")

entities.name: the cellar
entities.description: The cellar is mentioned as a place where the prisoners must be placed, indicating its importance or significance in the situation. ("The prisoners must be placed in the cellar")

entities.name: the courtyard
entities.description: The courtyard is mentioned as a place where the unconscious men may be left, indicating its importance or significance in the situation. ("leave them in the courtyard for me")

relationships.description: Bellatrix gives orders to Draco, indicating a level of authority or responsibility in the situation. ("Draco, move this scum outside")
Bellatrix and Narcissa have a conflict or disagreement, indicated by Narcissa's furious speech. ("Don't you dare speak to Draco like --")
Bellatrix is concerned about Potter, indicating his importance or significance in the situation. ("If it is indeed Potter, he must not be harmed")
Bellatrix seems to be obeying or following the instructions of the Dark Lord, indicated by her mention of his wishes. ("The Dark Lord wishes to dispose of Potter himself")
Bellatrix examines the sword, indicating its importance or significance in the situation. ("She stood, panting slightly, looking down at the sword, examining its hilt")
Bellatrix instructs someone to place the prisoners in the cellar, indicating her level of authority or responsibility in the situation. ("The prisoners must be placed in the cellar")
